    Systematic Literature Review

    Updated on 07/05/2021

    001_Systematic_Literature_Review.Rmd

    This article allows you to walk through an example using litsearchr to facilitate quasi-automatic search strategy development for systematic reviews.

    1. Literature search

    a) Marine Ecosystem

    • Keywords (Anywhere and all dates)
    "ecosystem+based+fisheries+management" AND
"stock+assessment" AND
"forecast" AND
"interdisciplinary"

    • Databases (NOAA Central Library was used to access the databases)

      • BioOne Complete
      • DOAJ: Directory of Open Access Journals
      • EconLit Full-Text
      • JSTOR
      • Web of Science
      • Wiley Online Library ebooks
        • Filters: Journals; AQUACULTURE, FISHERIES & FISH SCIENCE
        • \(n = 35\)

    Those databases were selected based on PIFSC suggestion.

    Citations can be found from inst/extdata/litsearch/

    1. Install packages

    # remotes::install_github("bai-li-noaa/IFA4EBFM", ref="main")
devtools::load_all()
remotes::install_github("elizagrames/litsearchr", ref="main")
library(IFA4EBFM)
library(litsearchr)

    If you receive errors related to C++ when loading r4MAS, please see the installation instructions from the main page.

    2. Load citations

    lit_path <- system.file("extdata", package = "IFA4EBFM")
